hints_html:
Rewrite the integral as \(\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.\)

Use the substitution \(\displaystyle u=e^{x}\).
hints_latex:
Rewrite the integral as
$\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.$
hints_raw:
Rewrite the integral as
<math>
\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.
</math>
Use the substitution <math>\displaystyle u=e^{x}</math>.
question: 1 (a)
sols_html:
Rewrite the integral as

\(\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.\)

Let \(u=e^{x}\). Then \(du=e^{x}dx\), and our new endpoints of integration are

\(e^{1}=e \qquad\text{ and }\qquad e^{0}=1.\)

Thus, our integral becomes

\(\int_{1}^{e} e^{u}du=e^{u}\mid _{1}^{e}=e^e-e.\)

Therefore, the correct answer is (ii).
sols_latex:
Rewrite the integral as

$\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.$

Let $u=e^{x}$. Then $du=e^{x}dx$, and our new endpoints of integration
are

$e^{1}=e \qquad\text{ and }\qquad e^{0}=1.$

Thus, our integral becomes

$\int_{1}^{e} e^{u}du=e^{u}\mid _{1}^{e}=e^e-e.$

Therefore, the correct answer is (ii).
sols_raw:
Rewrite the integral as 

<math>
\int_{0}^{1} e^{(x+e^{x})}dx=\int_{0}^{1} e^{x}e^{e^{x}}dx.
</math>

Let <math>u=e^{x}</math>. Then <math>du=e^{x}dx</math>, and our new endpoints of integration are

<math>
e^{1}=e \qquad\text{ and }\qquad e^{0}=1.
</math>

Thus, our integral becomes 

<math>
\int_{1}^{e} e^{u}du=e^{u}\mid _{1}^{e}=e^e-e.
</math>

Therefore, the correct answer is (ii).
statement_html:
Multiple Choice Question: Select ONE correct answer (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), or (v).

(a) The value of the integral

\[\begin{aligned} \int_0^1 e^{(x+e^x)}\,dx\end{aligned}\]

is

(i)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac{e^{(x+e^x+1)}}{(x+e^x+1)}\)

(ii)   \(\displaystyle {} e^e-e\)

(iii)   \(\displaystyle {} e^e+e\)

(iv)   \(\displaystyle {} e^{e+1}\)

(v)   \(\displaystyle {} (1-e)e\)
statement_latex:
Multiple Choice Question: Select \textbf{ONE} correct answer \emph{(i)},
\emph{(ii)}, \emph{(iii)}, \emph{(iv)}, or \emph{(v)}.

\textbf{(a)} The value of the integral

\begin{align*}
\int_0^1 e^{(x+e^x)}\,dx
\end{align*} is

\begin{description}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item[]
\emph{(i)} ~ $\displaystyle {} \frac{e^{(x+e^x+1)}}{(x+e^x+1)}$

\emph{(ii)} ~ $\displaystyle {} e^e-e$

\emph{(iii)} ~ $\displaystyle {} e^e+e$

\emph{(iv)} ~ $\displaystyle {} e^{e+1}$

\emph{(v)} ~ $\displaystyle {} (1-e)e$
\end{description}
statement_raw:
Multiple Choice Question: Select '''ONE''' correct answer ''(i)'', ''(ii)'', ''(iii)'', ''(iv)'', or ''(v)''.

'''(a)''' The value of the integral
:<math>
\int_0^1 e^{(x+e^x)}\,dx
</math>
is

:''(i)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac{e^{(x+e^x+1)}}{(x+e^x+1)} </math>
:''(ii)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} e^e-e </math> 
:''(iii)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} e^e+e </math> 
:''(iv)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} e^{e+1} </math> 
:''(v)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} (1-e)e </math>
